snippet: One voting precinct had a turnout of 107 percent, with just one person opting for a candidate other than Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin.
abstract: Flagrant electoral fraud in Russia's presidential election in Chechnya, where at one polling station the number of votes cast for Prime Min Vladimir V Putin outstripped the number of registered voters, shows the deep tolerance of undemocratic practices that persists in Russia, particularly in places beyond the reach of Western observers.
lead_paragraph: One voting precinct had a turnout of 107 percent, with just one person opting for a candidate other than Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin.

headline.seo: Fraudulent Votes for Putin Abound in Chechnya
headline.main: At Chechnya Polling Station, Votes for Putin Exceed the Rolls
headline.print_headline: At Chechnya Polling Station, Votes for Putin Exceed the Rolls
